intro: Galium pterocarpum, commonly known as the Indian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Galium pterocarpum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and woodlands.
